abstract.para: This is the offical manual of Amun.

chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: Amun is a content managment framework written in PHP 5 and based on the PSX framework. The goal of Amun is to build a more federated and programmable web. This is achieved by providing an RESTful API for managing and distributing the content in standard formats like JSON, XML, Atom and RSS.

chapter.title: Installation and Configuration
chapter.para: This chapter describes howto install and configure Amun properly.

sect1.title: Requirements
sect1.para: You need PHP >= 5.3 and a MYSQL database.

sect1.title: Prepare
sect1.para: The installation is done via an install script but before you can start it you have to make the following changes.

sect2.title: Setting rights
sect2.para: Amun needs write permissions to the folder "cache/".

sect2.title: Edit config
sect2.para: Open the file configuration.php and change the key "psx_url" to your domain. Note do not use a trailing slash. Also enter your connection data at the "sql_*" keys. It is recommended to change the "amun_salt" parameter to another random string.

sect1.title: Run installer
sect1.para: Point your browser to http://[server]/[path]/public/install.php and run the install script. Enter the data and click on install. Note the install script is based on javascript. If the installation was succesful you can goto the main page and login with your admin account.

sect1.title: Clean up
sect1.para: It is highly recommended that you delete the files wich are used by the install script.

chapter.title: Manage Amun
chapter.para: In order to manage Amun you need an client wich connects to the Amun API. By default amun offers a workbench wich offers basic functionallity to configure and control amun. The endpoint url is at "index.php/workbench". You can find a list of available backends at the website.

chapter.title: Service
chapter.para: In amun every functionality is provided via a service. All services are normally placed in the folder "service" but the location can be defined in the configuration at the point "amun_service_path". On Installation some basic services are installed but you can install and uninstall every service later on. An service can add functionality to the following sections.

sect1.para: The application represents the functionality on the website. In general it offers a user interface to use the API.

sect1.title: Gadget
sect1.para: A gadget is a small script wich can be loaded beside an application to display additional informations.
